Text:
You understand how how we're using the various tools, and what we are/are not using them for.  You you reframe this as an array of tools maybe.  I don't like the "used" format - but need to know how each tool plays a part.  I'm not totally sure.  Thoughts?
 "chessJSLibrary": {      "link": "https://github.com/jhlywa/chess.js",      "uses": [        "move legality",        "path finder",        "foundation for trainer platform"      ]    },    "stockfishEngine": {      "link": "https://pypi.org/project/stockfish/",      "uses": [        "best next moves",        "skill needed/evaluation",        "path finder",        "move legality",        "puzzle extraction from lichess source games"      ]    },    "lichessDatabase": {      "link": "https://database.lichess.org/#puzzles",      "uses": [        "puzzle sources",        "game sources"      ],      "missing_behaviors": [        "extracting puzzles from games",        "suggesting good solutions"      ]    },    "webTools": {      "interactiveChessboard": {        "link": "https://www.apronus.com/chess/pgnviewer/"      }    }

Here's a reframed version of the tools used in the project:

1. chessJSLibrary: 
   - Link: [chess.js](https://github.com/jhlywa/chess.js)
   - Uses:
     - Move legality
     - Path finder
     - Foundation for trainer platform

2. stockfishEngine:
   - Link: [Stockfish](https://pypi.org/project/stockfish/)
   - Uses:
     - Best next moves
     - Skill evaluation
     - Path finder
     - Move legality
     - Puzzle extraction from Lichess source games

3. lichessDatabase:
   - Link: [Lichess Database](https://database.lichess.org/#puzzles)
   - Uses:
     - Puzzle sources
     - Game sources
   - Missing behaviors:
     - Extracting puzzles from games
     - Suggesting good solutions

4. webTools:
   - Interactive Chessboard:
     - Link: [Apronus Chess PGN Viewer](https://www.apronus.com/chess/pgnviewer/)

These tools play different roles in the Chess Trainer project, providing functionalities such as move legality checking, path finding, puzzle extraction from Lichess games, utilizing puzzle and game sources, and offering an interactive chessboard for visualization and analysis.

You understand how how we're using the various tools, and what we are/are not using them for.  You you reframe this as an array of tools maybe.  I don't like the "used" format - but need to know how each tool plays a part.  I'm not totally sure.  Thoughts?
Why are we using each of the tools?  Can you create a new "tools" section that has links to, and describes the usage for each of the tools - along with a list of enough reasons that explain why we have to use each tool.

Certainly! Here's a new "tools" section that describes the usage and reasons for using each tool in the project:

"tools": [
  {
    "name": "Chess.js Library",
    "link": "https://github.com/jhlywa/chess.js",
    "usage": [
      "Move legality checking",
      "Path finding",
      "Foundation for the trainer platform"
    ],
    "reasons": [
      "Enables checking the legality of moves in the chess game",
      "Facilitates path finding and generating possible move sequences",
      "Forms the foundation for developing the chess training platform"
    ]
  },
  {
    "name": "Stockfish Engine",
    "link": "https://pypi.org/project/stockfish/",
    "usage": [
      "Determining best next moves",
      "Assessing skill level/evaluation",
      "Path finding",
      "Move legality checking",
      "Puzzle extraction from Lichess source games"
    ],
    "reasons": [
      "Provides the ability to calculate and suggest the best next moves in a given position",
      "Evaluates player skill levels and provides game evaluations",
      "Assists in finding paths or move sequences based on specific criteria",
      "Checks the legality of moves made by players",
      "Extracts instructive puzzles from source games obtained from Lichess"
    ]
  },
  {
    "name": "Lichess Database",
    "link": "https://database.lichess.org/#puzzles",
    "usage": [
      "Puzzle sources",
      "Game sources"
    ],
    "reasons": [
      "Provides a valuable source of puzzles for training purposes",
      "Serves as a database of chess games, which can be used as sources for puzzle extraction"
    ],
    "missing_behaviors": [
      "Extracting puzzles from games",
      "Suggesting good solutions"
    ]
  },
  {
    "name": "Interactive Chessboard",
    "link": "https://www.apronus.com/chess/pgnviewer/",
    "usage": [
      "Visualizing chess positions"
    ],
    "reasons": [
      "Enables the visualization of chess positions and moves for improved user experience",
      "Helps users understand and analyze chess positions more effectively"
    ]
  }
]

These tools are used in the project for various purposes, as described above, to enhance the chess training experience, enable puzzle extraction, evaluate game positions, provide move legality checks, and offer valuable puzzle and game sources.
